Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The article reviews five language learning apps: Babbel, Busuu Premium Plus, Memrise, Rosetta Stone, and Super Duolingo. The apps were tested for ease of setup, design, and features offered. Rosetta Stone was found to be the best language learning app overall due to its easy-to-use design and logical lesson format. The article provides a detailed description of the testing process and features of each app. Busuu Premium Plus is described as better for learners with prior exposure to the language, but with constant offers to spend more money. Memrise uses short videos and requires more focus and typing, but offers more advanced vocabulary. Super Duolingo takes small steps in learning and offers virtual celebrations for correct answers, making it fast and easy to use. Each app offers lessons in multiple languages and can be used as a web or mobile app. The prices for each app's subscription plans are also provided. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/best-language-learning-apps#maincontent)', '

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide a download link for Rosetta Stone. It is an advertisement promoting the language learning software and providing information about its benefits, success stories, and different language options. It also highlights the various solutions available for individuals, enterprises, and schools, as well as the company's curriculum, mobile app, and live coaching with native speakers. Links to the company's resources and support portal are provided.

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide a download link for the Rosetta Stone software. Instead, it offers different plans for individuals, enterprises, and schools to learn a variety of languages using the Rosetta Stone app. The plans include bite-sized lessons, offline access, speech recognition technology, and a 30-day money-back guarantee. The text also includes success stories from users who have used Rosetta Stone to learn languages. Additionally, the text provides information on how Rosetta Stone can be used in enterprise and school settings, and lists the 25 languages available for learning. The text also offers a lifetime subscription option and a gift option for Mother's Day.
